" 1 lb (450g) ground beef,
 1 tablespoon taco seasoning,
 1/4 cup water,
 Taco shells or tortillas,
 1 cup lettuce, shredded,
 1 cup tomatoes, diced,
 1/2 cup cheese, shredded (cheddar),
 Salsa, for serving,
 Sour cream, for serving" "

"
 (1)In a skillet over medium heat, brown the ground beef until fully cooked. Drain excess fat.
 (2)Add the taco seasoning and water to the skillet. Stir to combine and simmer for about 5 minutes.
 (3)Prepare the taco shells or tortillas according to package instructions.
 (4)Assemble the tacos by filling them with the beef mixture, lettuce, tomatoes, and cheese.
 (5)Serve with salsa and sour cream on the side.
"

" 4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts,
 1 cup breadcrumbs,
 1/2 cup grated Parmesan cheese,
 2 eggs, beaten,
 1 tablespoon Italian seasoning,
 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder,
 Salt and pepper to taste,
 Olive oil for frying,
 Marinara sauce, for serving,
 Fresh parsley, chopped, for garnish"

" 
 (1) Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
 (2) In a bowl, combine breadcrumbs, Parmesan cheese, Italian seasoning, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
 (3) Dip each chicken breast into the beaten eggs, then coat with the breadcrumb mixture.
 (4) Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat and cook the chicken until golden brown on both sides.
 (5) Transfer the chicken to a baking dish and bake for 20 minutes or until fully cooked.
 (6) Serve with marinara sauce and garnish with fresh parsley.
"

" 1 cup lentils, rinsed and drained,
 1 medium onion, chopped,
 3 garlic cloves, minced,
 1 teaspoon cumin,
 1/2 teaspoon thyme,
 Salt and pepper to taste,
 2 tablespoons olive oil,
 Fresh parsley, for garnish""

" 
 (1) In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat and sauté the onion, carrots, and celery until softened.
 (2) Add the garlic and cook for another minute.
 (3) Stir in the lentils, vegetable broth, diced tomatoes, cumin, thyme, salt, and pepper.
 (4) Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for about 30 minutes or until the lentils are tender.
 (5) Adjust seasoning if needed and garnish with fresh parsley before serving.
"

" 1 lb (450g) chicken, sliced,
 1 tablespoon red curry paste,
 1 can (13.5 oz) coconut milk,
 1 tablespoon brown sugar,
 1 lime, juiced,
 Fresh basil, for garnish,
 "

" 
 (1) In a large skillet, heat a bit of oil over medium heat and cook the chicken until browned.
 (2) Add the red curry paste and cook for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
 (3) Pour in the coconut milk and bring to a simmer.
 (4) Add the mixed vegetables, fish sauce, brown sugar, and lime juice. Simmer for about 10 minutes or until the vegetables are tender.
 (5) Serve hot over cooked rice and garnish with fresh basil.
"
